books.title: Pride and Prejudice
books.author: Jane Austen
books.description: A classic novel of manners and romance, exploring issues of class, marriage, morality, and first impressions through Elizabeth Bennet and Mr. Darcy.

books.title: The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
books.author: Mark Twain
books.description: A young boy, Huck Finn, runs away from his abusive father and travels down the Mississippi River; explores race, freedom, moral growth, and society’s injustices.

books.title: Jane Eyre
books.author: Charlotte Brontë
books.description: The life story of Jane Eyre, an orphaned girl who becomes governess at Thornfield Hall, falls in love with Mr Rochester, and endures moral and emotional trials.

books.title: War and Peace
books.author: Leo Tolstoy
books.description: A sweeping epic chronicling Russian society during the Napoleonic era; combines historical events with personal stories; deep philosophical, moral, and existential themes.

books.title: Crime and Punishment
books.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
books.description: A psychological novel about a poor ex‑student in Saint Petersburg who plans and carries out a murder, then experiences guilt, paranoia, moral agony, and spiritual awakening.

books.title: Wuthering Heights
books.author: Emily Brontë
books.description: Dark, passionate novel of love and revenge, set on the Yorkshire moors; explores destructive relationships, obsession, and social mores.

books.title: Moby‑Dick; or, The Whale
books.author: Herman Melville
books.description: A grand, symbolic novel about obsession: Captain Ahab’s quest to capture the white whale Moby Dick. Interwoven with meditations on nature, humanity, fate, and revenge.

books.title: The Lord of the Rings
books.author: J. R. R. Tolkien
books.description: Epic high fantasy about the quest to destroy the One Ring forged by the Dark Lord; traverses Middle‑earth with hobbits, elves, dwarves, men and wizards. Themes of courage, sacrifice, corruption, friendship.

books.title: Great Expectations
books.author: Charles Dickens
books.description: Follows the orphan Pip, his growth and moral development, his encounters with wealth, crime, love, and guilt; a study of character, social class and personal redemption.

books.title: On the Origin of Species
books.author: Charles Darwin
books.description: Groundbreaking scientific work introducing the theory of natural selection; radically shifted understanding of biology, evolution, and life itself.

books.title: The Prince
books.author: Niccolò Machiavelli
books.description: A political treatise about power: how rulers gain, maintain, and lose power; realpolitik; often controversial and widely studied.

books.title: A Vindication of the Rights of Woman
books.author: Mary Wollstonecraft
books.description: Lays out arguments for women’s education and political rights; early feminist philosophy; very influential in social thought.

books.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
books.author: Harper Lee
books.description: Set in the racially charged American South, it follows young Scout Finch and her father Atticus, a principled lawyer defending a Black man wrongly accused of rape. Themes of justice, empathy, moral growth, and social inequality.

books.author: George Orwell
books.description: A dystopian novel exploring life under totalitarian rule, surveillance, censorship, and the manipulation of truth through the eyes of Winston Smith. Chillingly prescient and politically critical.

books.title: The Catcher in the Rye
books.author: J. D. Salinger
books.description: Follows disenchanted teenager Holden Caulfield as he wanders New York City, rebelling against 'phoniness' and confronting grief and growing up. A key work in American coming-of-age literature.

books.title: Beloved
books.author: Toni Morrison
books.description: Inspired by true events, it tells the story of a formerly enslaved woman haunted by the ghost of her baby daughter. Explores trauma, memory, motherhood, and the legacy of slavery in America.

books.title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
books.author: Gabriel García Márquez
books.description: A magical realist epic tracing the rise and fall of the Buendía family in the fictional town of Macondo. Explores time, memory, solitude, and the cycles of history in Latin America.

books.title: The Great Gatsby
books.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
books.description: A tragic tale of love, ambition, illusion, and disillusionment in 1920s America, seen through the eyes of Nick Carraway as he observes the mysterious millionaire Jay Gatsby.

books.title: Frankenstein; or, The Modern Prometheus
books.author: Mary Shelley
books.description: A Gothic novel about Victor Frankenstein, who creates a sentient creature, then recoils from it. Explores themes of creation, responsibility, isolation, and what it means to be human.

books.title: The Road
books.author: Cormac McCarthy
books.description: A post-apocalyptic novel about a father and son's harrowing journey through a burned America, exploring themes of survival, love, hope, and the bond between parent and child.
